description: Returns the bundles that you can apply to an Amazon Lightsail instance when you create it. A bundle describes the specifications of an instance, such as the monthly cost, amount of memory, the number of vCPUs, amount of storage space, and monthly network data transfer quota.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: The token to advance to the next page of results from your request. To get a page token, perform an initial GetBundles request. If your results are paginated, the response will return a next page token that you can specify as the page token in a subsequent request.

parameters.name: appCategory
parameters.description: Returns a list of bundles that are specific to Lightsail for Research.

nested_items.name: bundles
nested_items.description: An array of key-value pairs that contains information about the available bundles.

nested_items.name: price
nested_items.description: The price in US dollars ( 5.0) of the bundle.

nested_items.name: cpuCount
nested_items.description: The number of vCPUs included in the bundle ( 2).

nested_items.name: isActive
nested_items.description: A Boolean value indicating whether the bundle is active.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: A friendly name for the bundle ( Micro).

nested_items.name: power
nested_items.description: A numeric value that represents the power of the bundle ( 500). You can use the bundle's power value in conjunction with a blueprint's minimum power value to determine whether the blueprint will run on the bundle. For example, you need a bundle with a power value of 500 or more to create an instance that uses a blueprint with a minimum power value of 500.

nested_items.name: ramSizeInGb
nested_items.description: The amount of RAM in GB ( 2.0).

nested_items.name: transferPerMonthInGb
nested_items.description: The data transfer rate per month in GB ( 2000).

nested_items.name: supportedPlatforms
nested_items.description: The operating system platform (Linux/Unix-based or Windows Server-based) that the bundle supports. You can only launch a WINDOWS bundle on a blueprint that supports the WINDOWS platform. LINUX_UNIX blueprints require a LINUX_UNIX bundle.

nested_items.name: supportedAppCategories
nested_items.description: Virtual computer blueprints that are supported by a Lightsail for Research bundle.

nested_items.name: publicIpv4AddressCount
nested_items.description: An integer that indicates the public ipv4 address count included in the bundle, the value is either 0 or 1.

nested_items.name: nextPageToken
nested_items.description: The token to advance to the next page of results from your request.
